cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn NNW tonight, then NE across Florida’s Big Bend on Thursday and accelerate NE just offshore of the U.S. southeast coast toward the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf Coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River FL to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch: west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then across the Florida Peninsula and up the southeast U.S. coastline (GA, SC, NC) before moving offshore of the mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Saturday with gusts below tropical-storm force (probability of 34-kt winds only 3%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Delaware River/Bay given the forecast offshore track
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain may bring 1–3 inches to Delaware late Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and dangerous rip currents along the Delaware and New Jersey beaches beginning this weekend
